body: On Sept. 6, 1986, in Las Vegas, Nev., Mike Tyson and Alex Stewart fought in separate bouts on a card headlined by Michael Spinks against Steffen Tangstad. Tyson's fight was a $450,000 tune-up against Alfonzo Ratliff, a cruiserweight he knocked out in two rounds. Two and a half months later, Tyson would become the youngest heavyweight champion ever,
title: BOXING; Two Varying Paths Finally Meet in Ring

body: LEAD: A livery-cab driver was shot dead early yesterday in Brooklyn, the 31st livery- or gypsy-cab driver killed in New York City this year, the police said. A livery-cab driver was shot dead early yesterday in Brooklyn, the 31st livery- or gypsy-cab driver killed in New York City this year, the police said. Raul Clavejo, 25 years old, of 874 43d
title: Livery-Cab Driver Shot Dead; 31st New York Victim in '90

body: LEAD: Because of distractions sometimes created by onlookers, production companies are reluctant to divulge exact locations and times for film and television shoots. But over the next six weeks, at least seven films or television pilots will be shot at prominent locations around New York City, and observant passers-by may find themselves part of an
title: Films That Are Shooting

body: LEAD: A 15-year-old Bronx youth who was shot after apparently stumbling into a gang dispute on Tuesday afternoon said yesterday that he hid behind a car when he first heard shots, but that one fleeing gang member spotted him and fired three times. A 15-year-old Bronx youth who was shot after apparently stumbling into a gang dispute on Tuesday
title: Youth Was Shot After Stumbling Into Dispute

body: LEAD: Parents of about a dozen students at a Brooklyn junior high school are threatening to keep their children out of class tomorrow to protest the presence of an 11-year-old boy who recently revealed that he is infected with the AIDS virus. Parents of about a dozen students at a Brooklyn junior high school are threatening to keep their children
title: Parents Vow to Protest AIDS Student

body: LEAD: One thousand feet above the noisy, crowded, fast-paced world that is street-level New York, the city is transformed into a serene, toylike configuration of buildings, streets, parks and waterways. Although such vistas are normally restricted to high-flying birds, New Yorkers and visitors can find their own sky-high perches at observation
title: Above It All

body: LEAD: Two men described as top Mafia leaders, who disappeared in May shortly before their indictment on racketeering charges, are believed to be hiding together in the New York City area, law-enforcement authorities say. Two men described as top Mafia leaders, who disappeared in May shortly before their indictment on racketeering charges, are
title: 2 Mob Fugitives Hiding In New York, Police Say

body: LEAD: A 16-year-old Brooklyn high school student was shot and critically wounded yesterday during a disputeover an expensive coat, the police said. A 16-year-old Brooklyn high school student was shot and critically wounded yesterday during a disputeover an expensive coat, the police said. Officers said the student, Peter Andrews of 103d Street in
title: Brooklyn Youth Is Wounded in Dispute Over Coat

body: LEAD: A blazing shootout between two robbers and two guards behind the automatic teller machines of an East Side bank yesterday afternoon left one suspect dead and one guard wounded, the police said. A blazing shootout between two robbers and two guards behind the automatic teller machines of an East Side bank yesterday afternoon left one suspect
title: Bank Guard Kills Suspect In a Shootout on East Side

body: LEAD: New York City has scheduled an auction next month of 13 acres of vacant land in southeastern Brooklyn near the boat slips and clam shanties along Paerdegat Basin, which leads into Jamaica Bay. The Department of General Services' Division of Real Property is offering the tract as two plots, one of 340,000 square feet with a minium price of $6
title: POSTINGS: 13 Acres in Brooklyn; Land for Houses
